title: MinIO Installation (Docker Quick Start)
description: A quick start guide to installing MinIO using Docker.

steps.description: If you don't have Docker installed, you'll need to install it first. You can find instructions on the official Docker website.

Open your terminal or command prompt and execute the following command to pull the MinIO image and run a standalone MinIO server. This command maps port 9000 (for the S3 API) and 9001 (for the MinIO Console) from the container to your host machine. `/data` is the directory inside the container where MinIO will store its data. `--console-address ":9001"` specifies that the MinIO Console will be available on port 9001.
Once the Docker container is running, you can access the MinIO Console (a web-based object browser) by opening your web browser and navigating to `http://127.0.0.1:9001`.
The default root credentials for the MinIO deployment are `minioadmin` for both the access key and the secret key.
